This guide is for all all stakeholders involved in #Brownfield cleanup #LandContamination https://t.co/0lrZywtUT8

The state of our planet isn't a done deal.

entity.name: Nature
entity.description: Consistently stunning documentaries transport viewers to far-flung locations ranging from the torrid African plains to the chilly splendors of icy Antarctica. The show's primary focus is on animals and ecosystems around the world. A comic book based on the show, meant to be used an as educational tool for kids, was briefly distributed to museums and schools at no cost in the mid-2000s.

tweets.text:
We're investigating this illegal #waste site in the grounds of a listed building near #Shrewsbury whilst observing Coronavirus guidelines. 

Help us in the fight against #wastecrime by checking your waste carrier has a permit to take your waste away: https://t.co/iIwy6eBdSr https://t.co/pyi4VrhD6D

Breaking: Investors with ¬£10tn in assets call on UK Govt to issue sovereign #greenbonds to drive climate action and social renewal in the Covid-19 recovery. 
Read the full statement & signatories list at @GFI_green. https://t.co/ZzmLygfzYF #greenfinance

tweets.text: Do you have experience in #NFM natural #flood management? If so, we need your help with a project that is looking at making the funding process easier. Tell us more about your experience with NFM funding in this quick survey: https://t.co/N8bYFaKQyn @slowtheflow_UK https://t.co/5ZUTW8Uf9G

Just look at this blockage @stwater have had to clear from one of their sewers.

It's just one of thousands they have to clear every year. 
 
Most are caused by people flushing the wrong things down the toilet and fat & oils down the sink.

#Unblocktober  https://t.co/ZvvnIbraDr https://t.co/wnEqNXaUjs

Introducing The Earthshot Prize, the most prestigious global environment prize in history.

This new global prize for the environment will incentivise change and help to repair our planet over the next ten years ‚Äì a critical decade for the Earth. https://t.co/biAZecHuml

Thanks to @Naturalkirklees for funding #Japaneseknotweed control work in some of the Kirklees MBC greenspaces. A massive thanks to Steve for his help controlling the knotweed at Birkby Wildlife Garden and Birkby allotments #INNS @EnvAgency @YISF__INNS  üçÉ https://t.co/Zs8REwJq4Q

tweets.text:
A massive thank you to our #CleanAirDay partners!

@DefraUKAir, @EnvAgency, @EPScotland, @WGEnviroAgri, @PhilipsFDN, @FIAFdn, @Zehnder_UK, @OpiniumResearch, @ZipcarUK, @ENGIE_UK, @meuk_les, The Clean Breathing Institute & of course @airqualitynews for streaming #CleanAirDayLiveüéâ https://t.co/hogmiFeGCk

Great to be working with @EdenRiversTrust and @NetworkRailLC to deliver this major restoration project in #Thrimby. 

The work carried out here will help restore the River Leith to its former glory, boosting biodiversity in the process for the benefit of generations to come! https://t.co/SHTQ6a7P6g
Lovely week #Surveying the Wantsum in Kent for the @EnvAgency #sunset https://t.co/tNKPeQtXEh

A warm welcome to Dr Andy Bray, our new Project Manager for all our Calder Catchment Partnership work. Andy will be working closely with our stakeholders in the catchment - developing new and exciting river improvement projects in Calderdale, Kirklees, and Wakefield. https://t.co/eJNJX6Ixfi

Our October flood newsletter is now out. Features include:

- Timescales extended for property flood grants
- Mytholmroyd flood scheme moves steps closer to completion
- Wardens build flood containers for hillside communities

Read it here: https://t.co/AXTKqO1tJq
@EnvAgencyYNE https://t.co/q7h7sEgao5

Looks like the sunshine is back in the south east! If you‚Äôre out by our waterways, remember the ground might still be a bit slippery after all the rain. Here‚Äôs some advice from our friends @CanalRiverTrust on staying safe on towpaths. https://t.co/FOBz1PuDWn

tweets.text:
We work around the clock to reduce pollution, from monitoring air quality to regulating industries.    

This #CleanAirDay visit the Clean Air Hub to find out more about how you can help tackle #AirPollution too: https://t.co/HZwu2lIpcU https://t.co/nnAKbdarLJ

Today is clean air day!

Did you know that our officers take air quality samples which are then given to Public Health England who analyse the samples and work out if there is harm to the public? üí≠

#Teamwork #CleanAirDay @PHE_uk https://t.co/lpPtHaXKuw

Works to improve flood defences in #Fishlake, #Doncaster, which was badly hit by the November floods, are due to start this month. Our contractors @BAMNuttall have set up a site compound to start work. We're also inspecting defences to ensure we're #WinterReady https://t.co/GS8qzbI1uj

@takaraalf @WildStoke @EnvAgencyMids @theriverstrust @SoTCityCouncil @urban_cic @MindCharity It‚Äôs alway sad to see summer go but I agree the colours around at the moment are glorious again. Although it was grey on this mornings early dog  walk. The yellows and reds are beautiful. https://t.co/AIgPqaSxnV

Spent some time over the last few weeks mulling over the proposals in the government's Planning for the Future consultation. While there are some interesting ideas, I also have some concerns and currently working up a response to @mhclg. Have your say too: https://t.co/X0OH9F0jtF https://t.co/e2YlYLcae6
@CarlJCroft @WildStoke @EnvAgencyMids @theriverstrust @SoTCityCouncil @urban_cic @MindCharity The colours are incredible.  Autumn is my favourite:)
We are back in #Twerton after #StormAlex and are continuing to lift and inspect boats... https://t.co/kQ9Gp2wUER
@jameslodge @EnvAgencySE Hi James, we have raised this with the service.

The Property Flood Resilience Emag sponsored by @EnvAgency & @floodre has been updated with more case studies where people have installed property flood resilience in their homes, reporting on how installations performed in recent floods. https://t.co/Tvl6R1sjC0

Check out @BBCTees tonight between 4-6pm when @ScottMakinRadio chats with Sarah Duffy @EnvAgency about the new partnership campaign to keep people safer along the #Redcar #Cleveland coastline ‚ÄúNo #selfie is worth your life‚Äù @CoastguardNE @RedcarCleveland https://t.co/X5xQgNMFg8 https://t.co/1fmS7gHxdF

@tom_sasse @reformthinktank ...Compares apples with oranges (CCS/FEMA/EMERCOM etc), underplays scale and importance of Fire and Rescue Services, @EnvAgency and others, and maybe misunderstands the formal (see @DefenceHQ 's Single Dept'l Plan) role for UK Armed Forces in support to civil authorities.

@NorthumbrianH2O @nwater_care @EnvAgencyYNE @unblocktober @WearRiversTrust @TyneRiversTrust @teesriverstrust @NorthWildlife @durhamwildlife @teeswildlife @Seasaver Wonder if the lads have found masks in the pipes yet

@tom_sasse Ok - have had a look through @reformthinktank 's #resilientstate and in partic "Rethinking homeland resilience".  Some good stuff in there - we prob are too reliant on armed forces.  However...

Exposed peat with nothing growing is an environmental disaster, releasing carbon, susceptible to erosion, contaminating water, and increasing the likelihood of flooding. 
The first step towards healing - spread heather brash (chopped heather) and seed: https://t.co/imBHQjFwtU https://t.co/PZZXmc1W2s

We're thrilled that @NaturalEngland Chair & @cisl_cambridge Fellow @TonyJuniper is the keynote for our upcoming webinar.

He will be joined by speakers from @theriverstrust, @EnvAgency & @DefraGovUK to discuss how policy enables UK Catchment Management.

https://t.co/iHu2cpTN7s https://t.co/tKqrEAoOQC

New river channel looking great today! Look out for us, @EnvAgencyNW and @NetworkRailLC talking about our partnership #riverrestoration project on @ITVborder tonight and @BBC_Cumbria tomorrow morning! #slowtheflow https://t.co/tLJgpNN7qa

Here‚Äôs the river at #Thrimby restored to its natural state away by @EdenRiversTrust from the WCML to make services more reliable.

It‚Äôs been delivered by pooling resources with @EnvAgencyNW 

It‚Äôs a win-win for üêü , #passengers & freight https://t.co/D4hufSMWrD

The #FieldTeam recently completed maintenance at a #Reservoir on the #RiverDon.

The large structure is the reservoir outlet. We store water, then release it when the peak of the flood has passed to keep #floodrisk minimised.

üíß This one site stores a huge 679 million litres üíß https://t.co/BhLPcCEwAT

Our Synoptic #Radar is finally up. It will map surface currents, #waves, & #nearshore morphology, with topo/bathy surveys underway, & #underwater sensors to follow soon, informing @EnvAgency in managing #PevenseyBay Barrier #Beach @OceanEarthUoS @geogsouthampton @unisouthampton https://t.co/o8LWnmxCqp

Great work by our installation team yesterday assisted ably by @snuffleapagus and @EnvAgency staff. Synoptic4D radar @Pevensey_Bay ready to collect coastal morphology and hydrodynamics data, part of a @OceanEarthUoS project with @Hachem_Kassem @DrJulianLeyland & @channelcoast ! https://t.co/83D7Qxuk7J

Merdon Castle, #Hampshire which is mostly covered by trees. Here using @EnvAgency 1m LiDAR: elevation, slope, apsect, contours and hillshade created with #MaploomApp Have a go yourself at https://t.co/UVDjmsM5R1 #HillfortsWednesday https://t.co/PpKGmAPHLu

Flood and Coastal Risk Management Programme Team Advisor @EnvAgencyNW in #Warrington 

See: https://t.co/oi3EaJBkZM

#EnvironmentalJobs #WarringtonJobs https://t.co/dinCZazf6H
